Key Arguments: The legislation is inappropriate and unnecessary.
The requirement for objectivity is impossible as humans are inherently subjective.
The bill could be abused and threatens freedom of speech, press, and religion.
Education and information awareness are better solutions to combat misinformation.
The bill is described as Orwellian and Communistic, threatening democracy.
Notable Quotes: This bill seems like the government acting as ‘the bullies’ in the school yard...
We do not need the government’s proposed Communications Legislation Amendment Bill 2023 to tell us what is right and wrong about information written or spoken.
In summary I believe this draft Bill to be Orwellian and Communistic in its very existence.
